ref_item.name: geko device
ref_item.description: Small transcutaneous electrical stimulator. Manufactured in UK by Firstkind UK Ltd, and licensed for use in humans

pred_item.name: Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation (NMES) - geko™ T-1
pred_item.description: The geko™ T-1 device (Firstkind Ltd, UK) is a neuromuscular electrical stimulation device applied transcutaneously to the common peroneal nerve at the knee. It delivers intermittent electrical pulses (27mA, 1 Hz, pulse width 70-560μs) to cause contractions of the anterior and lateral compartments of the leg. Devices were fitted bilaterally and worn for 4-6 hours per day, 5 days a week, for 6 weeks. The minimum pulse width to achieve dorsiflexion was used and adjusted by the patient for comfort.

ref_item.description: Doppler ultrasound measurements of femoral venous blood flow. The volume flow rate in blood vessel can be calculated by multiplying the cross-sectional area of the blood vessel by the mean velocity of the blood within it.

pred_item.measure: Change in femoral vein volume flow (VF)
pred_item.description: Percentage change in femoral vein volume flow measured by duplex ultrasound from baseline (device off) to device activation (device on) at 20 minutes, and at week 6
pred_item.timeFrame: Baseline (week 0) at 20 minutes of device activation, and week 6

ref_item.description: Clinical symptoms will be measured using questionnaires (AVVQ, VCSS)

pred_item.measure: Change in Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS)
pred_item.description: Physician-reported quality of life assessment measuring venous clinical severity

ref_item.description: Measured using ankle and calf circumference, and multiplying using "inverted cone" method

pred_item.description: Change in leg volume calculated using truncated inverted cone model from ankle and maximal calf diameters measured bilaterally
